title: The Gotham Storytelling Festival
description: Frigid New York’s annual Gotham Storytelling Festival returns with two weeks of tales from 20 diverse storytellers.

title: Concrete Temple Theatre's Concrete Boom
description: Concrete Temple Theatre presents three nights of cutting-edge puppetry and visual theatre at Dixon Place.

title: Angelika ‘Classics’ Screening Series
description: Village East by Angelika’s ‘Classics’ screening series celebrates iconic films. Next up: Terry Gilliam’s Twelve Monkeys (1995).

title: Biology on Tap: ‘Political Climate’ Edition
description: Bio and beer blend at the Biology on Tap speaker series, featuring talks, trivia, and prizes.

title: Fun by Design: The Interior Design Game Show
description: Two designers go head-to-head in challenges testing everything from speed CAD to identifying furniture in your favorite TV shows.

title: Living Radio: Contemporary Radio Drama, with a Revisionist Twist
description: Living Radio stages live performances of five short radio plays inspired by the news, with results ranging from wacky to reflective.

title: Miss Manhattan Non-Fiction Reading Series
description: Elyssa Goodman and R.C. Gstaad III’s monthly showcase for nonfiction writers returns with an evening of readings.

title: Not a Boy, Not a Girl Comedy Show
description: Will Morrison hosts an LGBTQ+ comedy/variety show at Crystal Lake. Tonight's lineup features comedians and burlesque performers.

title: Annual Hoboken Artists’ Studio Tour
description: Discover works by over 100 artists on this self-guided walking tour of Hoboken galleries, artists’ studios, group exhibitions, and public art displays.

title: Florence + The Machine Album Release Drag Show
description: Celebrate the release of Florence + The Machine’s sixth album at this drag show hosted by Megami and Atomic Annie.

title: Bitches Brew Comedy Show
description: This women-produced and-hosted comedy show conjures up big laughs in the back room of Halyards (Gowanus). Tonight's performers include Henry Sir, Sarah Adelman, James Mwaura, Chloe Branche, and Byron Austin.

title: Performa Biennial
description: The Performa performing arts festival celebrates its 20th anniversary with three weeks of commissions, live performances, screenings, walking tours, and more across Manhattan and Brooklyn.

title: Tom D’s Big New York Show
description: Comedian and licensed NYC tour guide Tom Delgado takes you through different aspects of NYC each month, with history, comedy, trivia with prizes, and special guests.

title: Feel the News with Marcela Onyango
description: In this monthly variety comedy show, ‘radical lefty’ comedian Marcela Onyango breaks down the latest headlines, helping you decide whether to be mad, glad, or just deeply confused.

title: St Kilda
description: Inspired by her Nebraska roots, her Scottish heritage, and the historic 1930 evacuation of Scotland’s archipelago St Kilda, Drama League nominee Jody Christopherson presents her one-woman ‘Scottish horror excursion with supernatural foley looping.’

title: UCBLK: A Variety Show Spotlighting Black Performers
description: Join hosts Justin Catchens, Dominique Kaplowitz, and Shem Pennant for a night of improv, sketch, stand-up, and more—featuring a dynamic lineup of black performers.

title: Chloe Radcliffe Special Taping Warm-Up Show
description: See comedian Chloe Radcliffe run through an hour of new material in preparation for an upcoming special taping.

title: New York City Marathon
description: Watch and cheer on 50,000 runners from around the world as they race 26.2 miles through the city’s five boroughs. Friday’s opening ceremony in Central Park features a parade of nations and concludes with fireworks.

title: Halloween Weekend Events
description: Check out our roundup of 30+ Halloween weekend events in NYC for $40 and under.

title: Rooftop Cinema Club
description: Take your movie night to new heights at Rooftop Cinema Club, the annual open-air movie series held at the third floor Skylawn rooftop of the Embassy Suites Hotel in Midtown. This year’s season wraps with films like Coco, Practical Magic, and more.

title: Knives Out Marathon at The Paris
description: The Paris Theater presents all three Knives Out films, featuring sneak preview screenings of Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery with filmmaker Rian Johnson in person on 11/2 + 11/4. Bonus: free popcorn at all screenings.
